result.execSummary:
The defendant Leon Jack Hudson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary (Room), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(f).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $1,000.00 to Global Restaurant Systems d/b/a Mo's Irish Pub; $3,150.00 to Gallagher Basset Services Inc.

Pay DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements.
AS TO RESTITUTON/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  Court ordered monies taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid while on Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in ful would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.

No contact with codefendant Leandre Brown.
*7/14/2015 credit amended to 68 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment. Be given job and vocational training.

No controlled substances or alcohol.
No contact with Mo's Irish Pub located at 142 W. Wisconsin Avenue, Milwaukee, WI.
No contact with codefendant Leandre Brown.
AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  Urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample unless previously provided.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms; and further advised of vonting ineligibility.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leon Jack Hudson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript of SENTENCING HEARING (52 pages) commencing JUNE 15, 2015 received and filed.
Per Order signed on July 14, 2014: credit amended to 68 days.
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction, signed and filed.  Copy sent to the Department of Corrections and the District Attorney's Office.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Dennis P. Moroney, Br. 20, for review. mag
DOC request to review sentence credit.
/in support of defendant, filed.  Copy sent to ADA Corr and Attorney Schubert.
State's Witness List received and filed.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Leon Jack Hudson in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Defendant Leon Jack Hudson in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called passed and recalled Parties advise the Court that they have reached a resolution in this case.  Pursuant to negotiations, the State moved to dismiss but read in Counts 2 and 3.  Court granted State's motion and ordered Counts 2 and 3 dismissed but read in.

AS TO COUNT 01:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20 on 6/15/15 at 8:30 a.m.  File retained in court.
/Submitted by the State amending count 1 to Burglary (Room) contrary to Wis. Stats. section 943.10(1m)(f). Class F felony.  Counts 2 and 3 remain the same.

Defendant Leon Jack Hudson in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Defendant Leon Jack Hudson in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned for Status conference to accompany defendant's trial case (14CF3050) before Br. 20.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.  File retained in court.
from insurer on behalf of the defendant filed.

Attorney Joseph Edward Schubert in court, defendant Leon Jack Hudson not in court, in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request a scheduling date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Leon Jack Hudson in court with attorney Steve Sargent for Joseph Edward Schubert.  Defendant Leon Jack Hudson in custody.  Ron Dague for Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #14CF3050 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Dale Devereaux-MPD Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MOE'S IRISH PUB, 142 W WISCONSIN AVE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring (24 HOUR CURFEW).

Defendant Leon Jack Hudson in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Leon Jack Hudson in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may quality to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
